section.title: Lobby Server Configuration
section.para: These settings apply to only the lobby server configuration.

section.title: WebListeningPort
section.para: Port to listen for web authentication or REST API requests on. This defaults to 10999. Do not expose this to clients if you use the REST API for your own site. Have users login through your site instead. If you give clients access to this port you should disable the REST API.

section.title: WebCertificate
section.para: SSL certificate for the web authentication or REST API. If blank, SSL is not used. It is highly recommended to use SSL, especially if the port is exposed to the internet. This should combine the certificate and any other certificates you need (like the CA cert).

section.title: WebRoot
section.para: Directory to add to the web authentication server. If blank no directory is added. This may not be safe when exposed to the internet. This directory should not contain symlinks as they may be followed.

section.title: WebAuthTimeOut
section.para: Number of seconds until a new lobby connection via web auth expires. If the user does not log into the lobby before this expires they have to start the login process over again.

section.title: ClientVersion
section.para: Version the client must be to login. This defaults to 1.666 (the last Japanese client release).

section.title: CharacterDeletionDelay
section.para: Number of minutes unil a character marked for deletion is deleted. This defaults to 24 hours.

section.title: CharacterTicketCost
section.para: Cost (in CP) to purchase another character ticket.

section.title: StartupCharacterDelete
section.para: Automatically deletes characters from a connecting world server that have a KillTime that has passed. If not enabled, these characters will be deleted the next time their associated account is sent the character list.

section.title: RegistrationCP
section.para: Amount of CP to give new accounts.

section.title: RegistrationTicketCount
section.para: Amount of character tickets to give new accounts.

section.title: RegistrationUserLevel
section.para: User level of new accounts. 0 is a normal account, anything non-zero is a GM and 1000 is a full GM with all permissions.

section.title: RegistrationAccountEnabled
section.para: Indicates if new accounts should be enabled by default.

section.title: PlayOpeningMovie
section.para: When set the opening cutscene will play for new accounts.

section.title: ImportStripUserLevel
section.para: Reset the user level of imported accounts to 0.

section.title: ImportStripCP
section.para: Reset the CP of imported accounts to 0.

section.title: ImportWorld
section.para: ID of the world to import characters into when importing account data.
